newsitem.title: FINLAND: OKOBANK EXCUSES FIM 190 MLN TO ITS REALUM.
newsitem.headline: OKOBANK EXCUSES FIM 190 MLN TO ITS REALUM.

text.p: Finnish cooperative banking group OKOBANK has excused 190 million markka of capital injections granted to its Osuuspankki Realum bank in 1993-1995, Realum said in a statement on Thursday.
The capital support had been granted to Realum by the cooperative banks' internal guarantee fund Osuuspankkien Vakuusrahasto, Realum said.
The 190 million markka now excused is part of a total of 3.5 billion markka of capital injected by the fund, a Realum official told Reuters by phone.
The move to excuse the funds owed was a "technical measure" related to earlier support decisions, Realum said.
Asked whether the fund would collect the rest of the outstanding capital support, Osuuspankki Realum officer Jouko Aho said: "Time will tell. Apparently most of it won't be collected."
Realum is what remains of the now defunct Suur-Helsingin Osuuspankki, he said.
